AnalystsTest.Text:
2/1/2014 11:31:36 AM
In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country? 

                                 Yes, I feel their is gap between healthcare supply and demand in India.The patient care have to be increased with giving them more of care what they actually need rather than treating with in a wrong way.In india their are so many cases regarding the health care where their was a wrong way of treating the patients. Mainly in rural areas in  India this kind of service is not taken care.

                         Government of India has to take certain steps to improve the quality of health care. Their should be legal and standard rules that every health care organization has to follow. The supply and demand in the health care is not matching due to several reasons. The doctors also have to be licensed based on their career as well as their specifications. 

                                        The supply and demand have to match accordingly for a complete patient care. The demand in health care will only match when their is a effective supply what is actually needed. In India their is a lot of gap in the health care where in the government has to take several steps to ensure the supply of health care for a better patient care.

                                                  I feel government has to take up certain legal obligations also which every health care organization has to follow and government should also have the right to take actions if any illegal decisions have been taken by the health care organization. Now-a-days many people lost their lives because of doctor's mistake.

                                                         Government of India have to keep a rule where in the health care organization have to be register where they have to follow the obligations imposed by the government. Government involvement is also necessary to make sure the supply and demand in health care. It is also important that the patient care also have to be taken into account.

                                                     Patient care have to be given high priority for the success of any health care organization. It plays a important role where their should be a effective steps to be followed for the improvement of patient care. Patients have to be treated in accordance with their requirement and what actual treatment they require.

                                                      Government of India should also sue the doctors without license. In India their are number if doctors who have license but they are not capable off. Again this problem is because of corruption which has increased in India. Corruption is also one of the major factor that has increased the gap between supply and demand. 

                                                    Government can also impose a right to the people if anything against the given obligations is taking place. In any health care organizations for the effective functioning their should be a parallel chain of supply and demand. If their is no supply of the what ever is required by a health care organization the demand of the patients can't be reached.

                                                     For the government health care organization which is owned by the government also have to follow the legal obligations. In fact the treatment in such organization should be cheaper because most of the rural areas in India would prefer them. Now-a-days their are many health insurance where people can secure their lives. For the expensive treatments this insurance would help those who can't afford. In most of the rural areas in India the government should take certain measures.

                                                In every health care organizations their should be proper health care programs conducted so that every employee can know steps to be taken for proper patient care. The health care programs and plans should also match with the supply in the health care. Un till and unless the supply is known the plans can't be made.

                                                 The doctors who are not eligible should not be given the license. This should be one of the main obligation that have to imposed by the government. The is the main reason where in the patient care has come down.

                                                       Finally I would like to conclude saying that Government of India should impose the legal rules and regulations for all the health care organizations which leads to the decrease in the gap of supply and demand of health care in India which in turn leads to proper patient care.
